result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ontarius M Mcferren

records.addlTxt:
9:15 AM Defendant Ontarius M Mcferren in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case is being recalled.
Court states appearances.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant is vacated.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant would like to be represented in this case.

Court will not take a plea.
Court advises Defendant to go to the public defender's office today.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:05 AM Defendant Ontarius M Mcferren not in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

Defendant fails to appear. Summons was sent. 

State requests warrant with cash alternative.
Court reviews the file. 
Atty Mutchler is not aware of getting any calls from Defendant, may get wrapped up in another matter in Ozaukee County, but is not aware of anything else. 
Court questions Atty Mutchler further. 
Discussions continue.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders warrant, cash alternative $500.
Initial Appearance set for 10/24/22 @ 9:00 a.m. in Br 3

9:32 AM Defendant Ontarius M Mcferren not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Court reviews the file.

Defendant does not appear but there is confusion as to the court date.
Notice went out for Oct 24th but Summons states today's date.

Matter will be rescheduled.
Perhaps the DA's office can send another summons out for the next date.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial Appearance set for 10/17/22 @ 9:00 a.m. in Br 3

9:56 AM Defendant Ontarius M Mcferren not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Dodge addresses the Court, drove to the city of Portage, not in Portage County.
State moves to adjourn.

Discussions continue between State and Court.

Matter will be adjourned.

Bond will be continued.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial Appearance set for 09/26/22 @ 9:00 a.m. in Br 2
Summons - adjourning matter from August 22nd to September 26th.
Comply with all open bond conditions

Defendant Ontarius M Mcferren appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Ontarius M. Mcferren 

Br II UDAR Start: 1:01 PM 
ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bail Jumping
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
